Foreign Relations, 1977–1980, Volume XXIII, Mexico, Cuba, and the Caribbean, 1977–1980
Guyana
Foreign Relations, 1977–1980, Volume XXIII, Mexico, Cuba, and the Caribbean, 1977–1980
Guyana
272. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, January 19, 1977, 1135Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D770020–0052. Confidential; Priority. Repeated for information to Brasilia, Bridgetown, Caracas, Kingston, Nassau, Paramaribo, Port of Spain, and USUN.
273. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, January 20, 1977, 1830Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, [no film number]. Secret; Exdis. Repeated for information to Brasilia, Bridgetown, Caracas, Kingston, Paramaribo, Port of Spain, and USUN.
274. Action Memorandum From the Acting Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs (Luers) to Secretary of State-Designate Vance
Washington, January 21, 1977
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P770021–2319. Confidential. Drafted by Luers and Heavner. Sent through Habib. Deputy Executive Secretary Frank Ortiz wrote in the margin, “Oral Instructions to ARA by Mr. Habib.”
275. Memorandum of Conversation
Washington, March 9, 1977, 6:15 p.m.
Source: Carter Library, National Security Affairs, Staff Material, North/South, Pastor, Country, Box 24, Folder: Guyana 1/77–12/78. Confidential. Drafted by Tumminia; approved by Twaddell. Foreign Minister Wills visited Washington March 5–9, and met with Secretary Vance on the last day of his visit. The meeting was held in Habib’s office.
276. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, April 1, 1977, 1900Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D770113–0421. Limited Official Use; Priority.
277. Telegram From the Department of State to the Embassy in Guyana
Washington, May 20, 1977, 0502Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D770181–0979. Confidential; Limdis. Drafted by Wheeler, Tumminia, and Cundiff; cleared in A, AA/PPC, AA/LA, LA/DP, Treasury, EB, FFP, SER/H, EBss/OFP, LA/DR, and IMF/USD; approved by Luers.
278. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, June 8, 1977, 1745Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D770205–0325. Confidential. Repeated for information to Brasilia, Bridgetown, Caracas, Kingston, Port of Spain, and USUN.
279. Central Intelligence Agency Intelligence Information Cable
Guyana, August 29, 1977
280. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, September 8, 1977, 1700Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D770325–0838. Limited Office Use; Immediate.
281. Action Memorandum From the Acting Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs (Devine) to Secretary of State Vance
Washington, September 21, 1977
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P850157–0252. Confidential. Drafted by Tumminia; cleared by Bova. Sent through Habib. A written note on the first page reads, “Not necessary to go to Secy; approved by P.”
282. Memorandum From the Military Adviser to the Vice President (Matheny) to Robert Pastor of the National Security Council Staff
Washington, October 3, 1977
Source: Carter Library, National Security Affairs, Staff Material, North/South, Pastor, Country, Box 24, Folder: Guyana, 1/77–12/78. No classification marking.
283. Memorandum From Robert Pastor of the National Security Council Staff to the President’s Assistant for National Security Affairs (Brzezinski)
Washington, February 24, 1978
Source: Carter Library, National Security Affairs, Staff Material, North/South, Pastor, Country, Box 24, Folder: Guyana, 1/77–12/78. Confidential.
284. Memorandum From Robert Pastor of the National Security Council Staff to the President’s Assistant for National Security Affairs (Brzezinski)
Washington, April 4, 1978
Source: Carter Library, National Security Affairs, Staff Material, North/South, Pastor, Country, Box 24, Folder: Guyana, 1/77–12/78. Confidential. Sent for action.
285. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, April 27, 1978, 1130Z
Source: Carter Library, National Security Affairs, Staff Material, North/South, Pastor, Country, Box 24, Folder: Guyana, 1/77–12/78. Secret; Stadis; Exdis.
286. Memorandum of Conversation
Georgetown, September 15, 1978
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P850157–0707. Confidential; Limdis. Drafted by Burke on September 19.
287. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, September 25, 1978, 1840Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D780392–0446. Limited Official Use; Priority; Stadis.
288. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, November 5, 1978, 1340Z
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, D780457–0244. Limited Official Use; Niact Immediate.
289. Briefing Memorandum From the Assistant Secretary of State for Consular Affairs (Watson) to the Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs (Newsom)
Washington, November 20, 1978
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P780182–0554. Limited Official Use. Drafted by Henneke and Horan in CA; cleared by McCoy. Copies were sent to Christopher, Tarnoff, Vaky, Bennet, a working group on the issue, and PA.
290. Briefing Memorandum From the Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs (Vaky) to Acting Secretary of State Christopher
Washington, November 21, 1978
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P780181–2414. Limited Official Use. Drafted by George E. Brown (ARA). Secretary of State Vance was in Argentina.
291. Central Intelligence Agency Intelligence Information Cable
Washington, November 21, 1978
Source: Federal Bureau of Investigation, Case Classification 89, Assaulting or Killing a Federal Officer, Case File 4286, Section 2, Document 190. Secret; Noforn; Nocontract; Wnintel.
292. Briefing Memorandum From the Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs (Vaky) to the Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs (Newsom)
Washington, November 30, 1978
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P780182–2415. Confidential. Drafted by McCoy; cleared in L/ARA.
293. Telegram From the Embassy in Guyana to the Department of State
Georgetown, November 30, 1978
294. Letter From Senator Jesse Helms to Secretary of Defense Brown
Washington, November 30, 1978
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P780181–0242. No classification marking. The letter was forwarded to Bennet on December 5, under a covering memorandum from Herbert. In a December 5 letter to Helms, Herbert told him to expect a response from the Department of State. (Ibid.)
295. Memorandum From the Deputy Political Counselor of the Mission to the United Nations (Blacken) to the Director of the Office of Caribbean Affairs (Hewitt)
New York, December 5, 1978
Source: National Archives, RG 59, Central Foreign Policy File, P800141–0757. Confidential.
296. Memorandum of Conversation
Georgetown, August 15, 1979
Source: Carter Library, National Security Affairs, Staff Material, North/South, Pastor, Country, Box 24, Folder: Guyana, 1/78–8/80. Confidential. Drafted by Kennedy; cleared by Habib.
